description: This course equips students to act ethically in for-profit and non-profit business settings by
introducing diverse ethical frameworks and encouraging the use of personal character strengths.
Learners engage with moral dilemmas using these frameworks, complete a virtue profile analyzing
their top five strengths, and participate in reflection posts and case studies to critically
assess their ethical perspectives. Offered annually in the spring. Prerequisite: BUS 110
Fundamentals of Business or by permission of the instructor.
